metadata.name: Event Grid Namespaces
metadata.description: This module deploys an Event Grid Namespace.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of the private endpoint.
Optional. The location to deploy the private endpoint to.
Optional. The name of the private link connection to create.
Optional. The subresource to deploy the private endpoint for. For example "vault", "mysqlServer" or "dataFactory".
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Required. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The private DNS zone group to configure for the private endpoint.
Optional. If Manual Private Link Connection is required.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with the manual connection request.
Optional. FQDN that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
Required. A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private IP address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Specify if you want to deploy the Private Endpoint into a different resource group than the main resource.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. Name of the Event Grid Namespace to create.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Resource tags.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.

Optional. Allows the user to specify if the namespace resource supports zone-redundancy capability or not. If this property is not specified explicitly by the user, its default value depends on the following conditions: a. For Availability Zones enabled regions - The default property value would be true. b. For non-Availability Zones enabled regions - The default property value would be false. Once specified, this property cannot be updated.
Optional. This determines if traffic is allowed over public network. By default it is enabled. You can further restrict to specific IPs by configuring.
Optional. This can be used to restrict traffic from specific IPs instead of all IPs. Note: These are considered only if PublicNetworkAccess is enabled.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Optional. Indicates if Topic Spaces Configuration is enabled for the namespace. This enables the MQTT Broker functionality for the namespace. Once enabled, this property cannot be disabled.
Optional. Alternative authentication name sources related to client authentication settings for namespace resource. Used only when MQTT broker is enabled ('topicSpacesState' is set to 'Enabled').
Optional. The maximum session expiry in hours. Used only when MQTT broker is enabled ('topicSpacesState' is set to 'Enabled').
Optional. The maximum number of sessions per authentication name. Used only when MQTT broker is enabled ('topicSpacesState' is set to 'Enabled').

Optional. Resource Id for the Event Grid Topic to which events will be routed to from TopicSpaces under a namespace. This enables routing of the MQTT messages to an Event Grid Topic. Used only when MQTT broker is enabled ('topicSpacesState' is set to 'Enabled'). Note that the topic must exist prior to deployment, meaning: if referencing a topic in the same namespace, the deployment must be launched twice: 1. To create the topic 2. To enable the routing this topic.
Optional. Routing enrichments for topic spaces configuration.  Used only when MQTT broker is enabled ('topicSpacesState' is set to 'Enabled') and routing is enabled ('routeTopicResourceId' is set).

Conditional. Routing identity info for topic spaces configuration. Required if the 'routeTopicResourceId' points to a topic outside of the current Event Grid Namespace.  Used only when MQTT broker is enabled ('topicSpacesState' is set to 'Enabled') and routing is enabled ('routeTopicResourceId' is set).
Optional. All namespace Topics to create.

Optional. CA certificates (Root or intermediate) used to sign the client certificates for clients authenticated using CA-signed certificates.  Used only when MQTT broker is enabled ('topicSpacesState' is set to 'Enabled').
Optional. All namespace Clients to create. Used only when MQTT broker is enabled ('topicSpacesState' is set to 'Enabled').
Optional. All namespace Client Groups to create. Used only when MQTT broker is enabled ('topicSpacesState' is set to 'Enabled').
Optional. All namespace Topic Spaces to create. Used only when MQTT broker is enabled ('topicSpacesState' is set to 'Enabled').
Optional. All namespace Permission Bindings to create. Used only when MQTT broker is enabled ('topicSpacesState' is set to 'Enabled').

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
variables.identity: [if(not(empty(parameters('managedIdentities'))), createObject('type', if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'systemAssigned'), false()), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'SystemAssigned,UserAssigned', 'SystemAssigned'), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'UserAssigned', 'None')), 'userAssignedIdentities', if(not(empty(variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'))), variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'), null())), null())]

properties.topicSpacesConfiguration: [if(equals(parameters('topicSpacesState'), 'Enabled'), createObject('state', parameters('topicSpacesState'), 'clientAuthentication', if(not(empty(parameters('alternativeAuthenticationNameSources'))), createObject('alternativeAuthenticationNameSources', parameters('alternativeAuthenticationNameSources')), null()), 'maximumSessionExpiryInHours', parameters('maximumSessionExpiryInHours'), 'maximumClientSessionsPerAuthenticationName', parameters('maximumClientSessionsPerAuthenticationName'), 'routeTopicResourceId', parameters('routeTopicResourceId'), 'routingEnrichments', if(not(empty(parameters('routeTopicResourceId'))), parameters('routingEnrichments'), null()), 'routingIdentityInfo', if(and(not(empty(parameters('routeTopicResourceId'))), not(startsWith(coalesce(parameters('routeTopicResourceId'), ''), format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}/providers/Microsoft.EventGrid/namespaces/{2}/topics/', subscription().subscriptionId, resourceGroup().name, parameters('name'))))), parameters('routingIdentityInfo'), null())), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

parameters.privateLinkServiceConnections: [if(not(equals(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'isManualConnection'), true())), createObject('value', createArray(createObject('name', coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'privateLinkServiceConnectionName'), format('{0}-{1}-{2}', last(split(resourceId('Microsoft.EventGrid/namespaces', parameters('name')), '/')), coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'service'), 'topic'), copyIndex())), 'properties', createObject('privateLinkServiceId', resourceId('Microsoft.EventGrid/namespaces', parameters('name')), 'groupIds', createArray(coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'service'), 'topic')))))), createObject('value', null()))]
parameters.manualPrivateLinkServiceConnections: [if(equals(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'isManualConnection'), true()), createObject('value', createArray(createObject('name', coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'privateLinkServiceConnectionName'), format('{0}-{1}-{2}', last(split(resourceId('Microsoft.EventGrid/namespaces', parameters('name')), '/')), coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'service'), 'topic'), copyIndex())), 'properties', createObject('privateLinkServiceId', resourceId('Microsoft.EventGrid/namespaces', parameters('name')), 'groupIds', createArray(coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'service'), 'topic')), 'requestMessage', coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'manualConnectionRequestMessage'), 'Manual approval required.'))))), createObject('value', null()))]

metadata.name: Private Endpoints
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint.
Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.
Required. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.

Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string.

Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string.
Required. A private IP address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Required. The name of the private link service connection.

Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string array `[]`.
Required. The resource id of private link service.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with this connection request. Restricted to 140 chars.
Required. Properties of private link service connection.
Required. The name of the private link service connection.

Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string array `[]`.
Required. The resource id of private link service.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with this connection request. Restricted to 140 chars.
Required. Properties of private link service connection.
Required. Fqdn that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
Required. A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Required. Name of the private endpoint resource to create.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Optional. The private DNS zone group to configure for the private endpoint.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. A grouping of information about the connection to the remote resource. Used when the network admin does not have access to approve connections to the remote resource.
Optional. A grouping of information about the connection to the remote resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Group.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Conditional. The name of the parent private endpoint. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Array of private DNS zone configurations of the private DNS zone group. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group.
The name of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource ID of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource group the private endpoint DNS zone group was deployed into.
The resource group the private endpoint was deployed into.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The name of the private endpoint.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The custom DNS configurations of the private endpoint.
The IDs of the network interfaces associated with the private endpoint.
The group Id for the private endpoint Group.

metadata.name: Eventgrid Namespace Topics
metadata.description: This module deploys an Eventgrid Namespace Topic.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent EventGrid namespace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the topic.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Event retention for the namespace topic expressed in days.
Optional. This determines the format that is expected for incoming events published to the topic.
Optional. Publisher type of the namespace topic.
Optional. All event subscriptions to create.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Event Subscriptions
metadata.description: This module deploys an Event Subscription.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent EventGrid namespace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent EventGrid namespace topic. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the Event Subscription to create.
Optional. Information about the delivery configuration of the Event Subscription.
Optional. The event delivery schema for the Event Subscription.
Optional. Information about the filter for the Event Subscription.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
The resource ID of the Event Subscription.
The name of the Event Subscription.
The name of the resource group the Event Subscription was created in.
The resource ID of the Namespace Topic.
The name of the Namespace Topic.
The name of the resource group the Namespace Topic was created in.

metadata.name: Eventgrid Namespace CA Certificates
metadata.description: This module deploys an Eventgrid Namespace CA Certificate.
Conditional. The name of the parent EventGrid namespace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the CA certificate.
Optional. Description for the CA Certificate resource.
Required. Base64 encoded PEM (Privacy Enhanced Mail) format certificate data.
The resource ID of the CA certificate.
The name of the CA certificate.
The name of the resource group the CA certificate was created in.

metadata.name: Eventgrid Namespace Clients
metadata.description: This module deploys an Eventgrid Namespace Client.
Conditional. The name of the parent EventGrid namespace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the Client.
Optional. Description of the Client resource.
Optional. The name presented by the client for authentication. The default value is the name of the resource.
Optional. The validation scheme used to authenticate the client.
Conditional. The list of thumbprints that are allowed during client authentication. Required if the clientCertificateAuthenticationValidationSchema is 'ThumbprintMatch'.
Optional. Indicates if the client is enabled or not.
Optional. Attributes for the client. Supported values are int, bool, string, string[].
The resource ID of the Client.
The name of the Client.
The name of the resource group the Client was created in.

metadata.name: Eventgrid Namespace Client Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys an Eventgrid Namespace Client Group.
Conditional. The name of the parent EventGrid namespace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the Client Group.
Required. The grouping query for the clients.
Optional. Description of the Client Group.
The resource ID of the Client Group.
The name of the Client Group.
The name of the resource group the Client Group was created in.

metadata.name: Eventgrid Namespace Topic Spaces
metadata.description: This module deploys an Eventgrid Namespace Topic Space.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent EventGrid namespace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the Topic Space.
Optional. Description of the Topic Space.
Required. The topic filters in the Topic Space.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
The resource ID of the Topic Space.
The name of the Topic Space.
The name of the resource group the Topic Space was created in.

metadata.name: Eventgrid Namespace Permissions Bindings
metadata.description: This module deploys an Eventgrid Namespace Permission Binding.
Conditional. The name of the parent EventGrid namespace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the Permission Binding.
Optional. Description of the Permission Binding.
Required. The name of the client group resource that the permission is bound to. The client group needs to be a resource under the same namespace the permission binding is a part of.
Required. The name of the Topic Space resource that the permission is bound to. The Topic space needs to be a resource under the same namespace the permission binding is a part of.
Required. The allowed permission.
The resource ID of the Permission Binding.
The name of the Permission Binding.
The name of the resource group the Permission Binding was created in.
The resource ID of the EventGrid Namespace.
The name of the EventGrid Namespace.
The location the EventGrid Namespace was deployed into.
The name of the resource group the EventGrid Namespace was created in.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The Resources IDs of the EventGrid Namespace Topics.
The private endpoints of the EventGrid Namespace.
